phyloregion 0.1.0
  • Reference

Convert point occurrences to community data

Source: R/points2comm.R
points2comm.Rd

points2comm converts point occurrence records (e.g. from GBIF, iDigBio) to a community data sample

points2comm(
  dat,
  mask = NULL,
  res = 1,
  lon = "decimallongitude",
  lat = "decimallatitude",
  species = "species",
  shp.grids = NULL,
  index = "taxon_richness",
  ...
)

Arguments

dat

A point occurrence data frame with at least three columns:

  • Column 1: species (listing the taxon names)

  • Column 2: decimallongitude (corresponding to decimal longitude)

  • Column 3: decimallatitude (corresponding to decimal latitude)
mask

a polygon shapefile covering the boundary of the survey region.
res

the grain size of the grid cells in decimal degrees (default).
lon

character with the column name of the longitude.
lat

character with the column name of the lattitude.
species

a character string. The column with the species or taxon name. Default = “species”.
shp.grids

if specified, the polygon shapefile of grid cells with a column labeled “grids”.
index

Diversity index, one of “taxon_richness” (default) or “abundance”.
...

Further arguments passed to or from other methods.

Value

  • comm_dat: community data frame

  • poly_shp: shapefile of grid cells with the values per cell.

Examples

require(raster)
s <- readRDS(system.file("nigeria/nigeria.rds", package="phyloregion"))

set.seed(1)
m <- data.frame(sp::spsample(s, 10000, type="nonaligned"))
names(m) <- c("lon", "lat")
species <- paste0("sp", sample(1:1000))
m$taxon <- sample(species, size = nrow(m), replace = TRUE)
pts <- points2comm(dat = m, mask = s, res = 0.5, lon="lon", lat="lat", species="taxon")

plot_swatch(pts$poly_shp, values = pts$poly_shp$richness, k=10)
